title: China aids Tanzania with Dar es Salaam University streetlight project
description: On August 22, 2019, the completion and handover ceremony of the Dar es Salaam University campus streetlight project was held on campus. The project provided 36 solar street lights for the 1-kilometer main road section of Dada. The project also used solar energy equipment. Power China Stecol Corporation was responsible for the construction.   Chinese Ambassador to Tanzania Wang Ke, alumnus of the University of Tanzania and General Secretary of the Revolutionary Party of Tanzania Bashiru, President of the University of Dar es Salaam, and more than a hundred people including Anangkisye, officials from the Ministry of Education and Technology of Tanzania, representatives of masters and students, representatives of Chinese enterprises undertaking the project, and journalists and media attended the event. The project was aided by the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China aids Tanzania with Dar es Salaam University streetlight project

# Description
On August 22, 2019, the completion and handover ceremony of the Dar es Salaam University campus streetlight project was held on campus. The project provided 36 solar street lights for the 1-kilometer main road section of Dada. The project also used solar energy equipment. Power China Stecol Corporation was responsible for the construction.   Chinese Ambassador to Tanzania Wang Ke, alumnus of the University of Tanzania and General Secretary of the Revolutionary Party of Tanzania Bashiru, President of the University of Dar es Salaam, and more than a hundred people including Anangkisye, officials from the Ministry of Education and Technology of Tanzania, representatives of masters and students, representatives of Chinese enterprises undertaking the project, and journalists and media attended the event. The project was aided by the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania.
justification: Primary purpose is installation of solar-powered streetlights, directly supporting renewable energy use
evidence: 36 solar street lights, solar energy equipment used, renewable energy focus

title: Chinese Embassy awards 12 winners of the China-Tanzania Friendship Documentary Essays Competition
description: On August 8, 2019, the Awards Ceremony of the China-Tanzania Friendship Documentary Essays Competition was held in the Embassy of China. Aiming at celebrating the 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and Tanzania, the essays competition was launched in February 4, 2019 and jointly held by the Embassy and Tanzania-China Friendship Promotion Association. The essays were submitted by May 15, 2019.12 winners were awarded during the ceremony. The winners had their essays published in Embassy website, Wechat and the Embassy Facebook Facebook account, The Oriental Post, Daily News, Habari Leo. The embassy also said they wanted to publish them in a book, but it is unclear whether or not this occurred.   The contestants used an article full of sincere emotions to convey the deep friendship between the two peoples, and also showed that China-Tanzania relations have always rooted in the people, relied on the people, and benefited the people. Murimaa, the first prize winner of the foreign language group, said that Tanzania-China cooperation provides important opportunities for the development of Tanzanian youths. Young people should understand and cherish the friendship between Tanzania and China, so that this precious wealth that has gathered the painstaking efforts of generations can be passed on from generation to generation. The representative of Zhang Junle, general manager of China-Turkey East Africa, the first prize winner of the Chinese category, said that the Tanzania-Zambia Railway is a monument of Sino-Tanzanian and China-Africa friendship. We must continue to sing and promote the spirit of the Tanzania-Zambia Railway and let it carry forward in the new historical period.

title: China Ministry of Commerce sponsors Clean Water and Garbage Disposal Overseas Training Course in Zanzibar
description: On June 25, 2019, Consul General Xie Xiaowu and Minister of Land, Housing, Water Conservancy and Energy Talib attended the opening ceremony of the “2019 Zanzibar Clean Water and Waste Treatment Overseas Training Course” and delivered speeches. The training was sponsored by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and undertaken by the China Power Construction Group. The training course was held from June 25 to July 24, 2019, with a total of 30 trainees. During the course, trainees learned about safe water and garbage disposal, and measures and methods to improve Zanzibar’s clean water and garbage disposal capacity.
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China Ministry of Commerce sponsors Clean Water and Garbage Disposal Overseas Training Course in Zanzibar

# Description
On June 25, 2019, Consul General Xie Xiaowu and Minister of Land, Housing, Water Conservancy and Energy Talib attended the opening ceremony of the “2019 Zanzibar Clean Water and Waste Treatment Overseas Training Course” and delivered speeches. The training was sponsored by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and undertaken by the China Power Construction Group. The training course was held from June 25 to July 24, 2019, with a total of 30 trainees. During the course, trainees learned about safe water and garbage disposal, and measures and methods to improve Zanzibar’s clean water and garbage disposal capacity.
justification: Training course focused on knowledge transfer and capacity building in water and waste management, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Clean water and garbage disposal training, capacity building focus, no infrastructure development

title: China sends 29th medical team to Zanzibar
description: On July 11, 2019, the 29th medical team sent by China arrived at Zanzibar, replacing the 28th medical team (project #88307). The Consulate General in Zanzibar hosted a reception to welcome the team.   Since 1963, some 220 million patients in 48 African countries have been treated by Chinese medical personnel as of 2018, according to the National Health Commission.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends 29th medical team to Zanzibar

# Description
On July 11, 2019, the 29th medical team sent by China arrived at Zanzibar, replacing the 28th medical team (project #88307). The Consulate General in Zanzibar hosted a reception to welcome the team.   Since 1963, some 220 million patients in 48 African countries have been treated by Chinese medical personnel as of 2018, according to the National Health Commission.
justification: Project involves medical assistance and healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment, healthcare services provided to patients

title: China Ministry of Commerce sponsors Food Nutrition and Hotel Management Overseas Training in Zanzibar.
description: On September 11, 2019, the 2019 Zanzibar Food Nutrition and Hotel Management Overseas Seminar sponsored by the China Ministry of Commerce began. The seminar was entrusted to the China National Research Institute of Food and Fermentation Industries Co., Ltd by the China National Agency for International Development Cooperation and the Ministry of Commerce. The training program was intended to last from September 11 to October 8, 2019, with a total of 45 trainees. The opening ceremony for the course was held at the Tanzanian Ministry of Tourism.  On September 10, 2019, Zanzibar President Shein met with experts in the Chinese foreign aid training program Zanzibar Food and Nutrition Overseas Training Course at the Presidential Palace to welcome them to Zanzibar. According to the China National Research Institute of Food and Fermentation Industries Co., Ltd, the Institute has been entrusted by the Ministry of Commerce to undertake overseas training courses in Zanzibar for three consecutive years, with a total of 128 trainees.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
China Ministry of Commerce sponsors Food Nutrition and Hotel Management Overseas Training in Zanzibar.

# Description
On September 11, 2019, the 2019 Zanzibar Food Nutrition and Hotel Management Overseas Seminar sponsored by the China Ministry of Commerce began. The seminar was entrusted to the China National Research Institute of Food and Fermentation Industries Co., Ltd by the China National Agency for International Development Cooperation and the Ministry of Commerce. The training program was intended to last from September 11 to October 8, 2019, with a total of 45 trainees. The opening ceremony for the course was held at the Tanzanian Ministry of Tourism.  On September 10, 2019, Zanzibar President Shein met with experts in the Chinese foreign aid training program Zanzibar Food and Nutrition Overseas Training Course at the Presidential Palace to welcome them to Zanzibar. According to the China National Research Institute of Food and Fermentation Industries Co., Ltd, the Institute has been entrusted by the Ministry of Commerce to undertake overseas training courses in Zanzibar for three consecutive years, with a total of 128 trainees.
justification: Project focuses on capacity building and training in food nutrition and hotel management, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Food nutrition and hotel management training program, sponsored by China Ministry of Commerce, focused on human capacity development

title: China donates office supplies to the Zanzibar Police Station.
description: On October 17, 2019, the ceremony of a donation of office supplies to the Zanzibar Police Station by the Consulate General in Zanzibar was held at the Zanzibar Police Station. The donation included some computers and other office equipment, and was made to improve office conditions and improve work efficiency. The value of the donation is not known.

title: Chinese Embassy awards the Chinese Ambassador Awards to 80 Tanzanian students
description: The Chinese Embassy in Tanzania held a Chinese Ambassador Scholarship Award Ceremony on November 22, 2019. A total of 80 Tanzanian students received this year's scholarship. The 80 students who won this award came from the Confucius Institute at the University of Dar es Salaam and the Confucius Institute at the University of Dodoma. 40 students from each institute received these scholarships.   This scholarship aims to help more Tanzanian students learn Chinese, strive for opportunities for further studies in China, and better serve Tanzania's construction in the future and promote exchanges and cooperation between China and Tanzania. The Chinese Embassy in Tanzania established the Chinese Ambassador Scholarship in 2018.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy awards the Chinese Ambassador Awards to 80 Tanzanian students

# Description
The Chinese Embassy in Tanzania held a Chinese Ambassador Scholarship Award Ceremony on November 22, 2019. A total of 80 Tanzanian students received this year's scholarship. The 80 students who won this award came from the Confucius Institute at the University of Dar es Salaam and the Confucius Institute at the University of Dodoma. 40 students from each institute received these scholarships.   This scholarship aims to help more Tanzanian students learn Chinese, strive for opportunities for further studies in China, and better serve Tanzania's construction in the future and promote exchanges and cooperation between China and Tanzania. The Chinese Embassy in Tanzania established the Chinese Ambassador Scholarship in 2018.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for Tanzanian students to learn Chinese and pursue studies in China, cultural exchange focus

title: Africa Growing Together Fund provides $42 million loan for Dodoma City Outer Ring Road Construction Project (Linked to Umbrella Project ID#36104)
description: On May 22, 2014, the African Development Bank (AfDB) and the People's Bank of China (PBOC) signed an agreement for the Africa Growing Together Fund (AGTF) (see Umbrella Project ID#36104). The purpose of this $2 billion loan facility was to finance large development projects in Africa between 2014 and 2024. The AGTF is sponsored by the PBOC and the administered by AfDB. Then, on August 19, 2019, AGTF signed an $42 million loan agreement (ID#5050200000801) with the Government of Tanzania for the Dodoma City Outer Ring Road Construction Project. On the same day, the African Development Bank (AfDB) issued a $138 million loan (ID#2000200003901) to the Government of Tanzania for the same project. The borrowing terms of these loans, which entered into force on November 18, 2019, are follows: a 24-year maturity, a 4-year grace period, an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus 0.89%, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.25% upfront (management) fee.   The purpose of the project is to improve transport within Dodoma City and decongest the city by constructing a new dual-carriageway Outer Ring Road (measuring 110.2 km in length). The project has two road construction subcomponents (or ‘lots’): Lot 1: Nala-Veyula-Mtumba-Ihumwa Dry Port (50.2 km); and Lot 2: Ihumwa Dry Port-Matumbulu-Nala (60.0 km). The project also includes several complementary interventions, including: (i) consulting services related to the road works and road studies; (ii) various specially-tailored social infrastructure benefitting women and youth; (iii) institutional capacity building; (iv) urban development related activities aimed at transforming Dodoma into a sustainable City in Tanzania, development of a water and sanitation master plan for Dodoma; and (v) compensation for Project Affected People (PAPs).   Significant expected outcomes include: (a) improved overall accessibility to, around and from Dodoma (i.e., increased ability of businesses to provide goods and services, and people’s ability to access education, employment and services); (b) a reduction in transportation costs (including travel time, vehicle operating costs, road and parking facility costs, accident and pollution damages); (c) improved urban planning and management; (d) increased economic productivity, employment generation and, in turn, regional economic development; and (e) a boost to regional integration – a crucial national and continental development objective. The immediate expected beneficiaries of the project include the residents in Dodoma City, its suburbs and the surrounding rural areas with a population of approximately 2.4 million people (2018), of which about a third (0.8 million people) live in the city. CCECC is the contractor responsible for implementation of Lot 1 and AVIC INTL Project Engineering Company is the contractor responsible for implementation of Lot 2. The first AfDB and AGTF loan disbursements took place on November 29, 2019. Civil works contracts were signed by the Tanzania National Roads Agency (TANROADS) and China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) and AVIC INTL Project Engineering Company on July 10, 2020 for Lot 1 and on July 4, 2020. However, advance payments have not yet been requested by the contractors. The project is planned to be implemented over a four-year period (including the Defects Liability Period).
staff_comments: 1. The AfDB project identification number is P-TZ-DB0-025. 2. This project is also known as the Dodoma City Outer Dual Carriageway Ring Road Project or the Construction Works of Dodoma City Outer Ring Road Project to Dual Carriageway (110.2 km). 3. The total project cost is USD 214.69 million. The project was financed with a USD 138 million AfDB loan, a USD 42 million AGTF loan, and USD 34.69 million of funding from the Government of Tanzania. 4. The methodology for the economic analysis is based on cost-benefit analysis (CBA) by comparing the “with” and “counterfactual” project scenarios for Dodoma City Outer Ring Road (110.2km), over a period of 20 years, using the Highway Development and Management Model (HDM-4). A discount rate of 12%, a standard conversion factor (SCF) of 0.82%, and construction period of 3 years starting in 2019 were adopted. The economic costs consist of: (i) the capital investment costs and (ii) the routine and periodic maintenance expenses. The benefits consist of savings in: (i) vehicle operating costs; (ii) motorized traffic travel time for passenger and cargo; and (iii) maintenance costs. The current (2017) Annual Average Daily Traffic (AADT) on the different Project road sections range from 4,901 to 15,667 vehicles per day. 5. The all-in interest rate (2.947%) was calculated by adding an 0.89% margin to the average 6-month LIBOR rate in August 2019 (2.057%). 6. The margin of 0.89% is calculated by adding the Financing Margin (-0.01%) to the Lending Spread (0.8%) and Maturity Premium (0.1%).
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title

# Description

The purpose of this $2 billion loan facility was to finance large development projects in Africa between 2014 and 2024. The AGTF is sponsored by the PBOC and the administered by AfDB. Then, on August 19, 2019, AGTF signed an $42 million loan agreement (ID#5050200000801) with the Government of Tanzania for the Dodoma City Outer Ring Road Construction Project. On the same day, the African Development Bank (AfDB) issued a $138 million loan (ID#2000200003901) to the Government of Tanzania for the same project. The borrowing terms of these loans, which entered into force on November 18, 2019, are follows: a 24-year maturity, a 4-year grace period, an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus 0.89%, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.25% upfront (management) fee. The project also includes several complementary interventions, including: (i) consulting services related to the road works and road studies; (ii) various specially-tailored social infrastructure benefitting women and youth; (iii) institutional capacity building; (iv) urban development related activities aimed at transforming Dodoma into a sustainable City in Tanzania, development of a water and sanitation master plan for Dodoma; and (v) compensation for Project Affected People (PAPs).   Significant expected outcomes include: (a) improved overall accessibility to, around and from Dodoma (i.e., increased ability of businesses to provide goods and services, and people’s ability to access education, employment and services); (b) a reduction in transportation costs (including travel time, vehicle operating costs, road and parking facility costs, accident and pollution damages); (c) improved urban planning and management; (d) increased economic productivity, employment generation and, in turn, regional economic development; and (e) a boost to regional integration – a crucial national and continental development objective. CCECC is the contractor responsible for implementation of Lot 1 and AVIC INTL Project Engineering Company is the contractor responsible for implementation of Lot 2. However, advance payments have not yet been requested by the contractors. The project is planned to be implemented over a four-year period (including the Defects Liability Period).
justification: Project focuses on road construction and urban development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Dual-carriageway Outer Ring Road construction, urban development activities, water and sanitation master plan development

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 118.9 million grant for Comprehensive Office Building Construction Project
description: On February 12, 2019, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) issued an RMB 118.9 million implementation contract to China Construction First Building (Group) Corporation Limited for the Comprehensive Office Building Construction Project in Tanzania. The purpose of this project is to construct a comprehensive office building (with 4-5 floors) in Dar es Salaam with a construction area of 12,600 square meters and a new annex building (1 floor above ground, 1 underground floor) in Dar es Salaam with a construction area of 332 square meters. As of July 2022, AidData had not yet identified any evidence of project implementation.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 中国援坦桑尼亚综合办公楼工程.2. China Construction First Building (Group) Corporation Limited — a wholly-owned subsidiary of China State Construction Engineering Corporation — was formerly known as China Construction First Engineering Bureau.
combined_text:
# Sector
BUSINESS AND OTHER SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 118.9 million grant for Comprehensive Office Building Construction Project

# Description
On February 12, 2019, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) issued an RMB 118.9 million implementation contract to China Construction First Building (Group) Corporation Limited for the Comprehensive Office Building Construction Project in Tanzania. The purpose of this project is to construct a comprehensive office building (with 4-5 floors) in Dar es Salaam with a construction area of 12,600 square meters and a new annex building (1 floor above ground, 1 underground floor) in Dar es Salaam with a construction area of 332 square meters. As of July 2022, AidData had not yet identified any evidence of project implementation.
justification: Project involves construction of office buildings without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of comprehensive office building and annex building, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Lancang-Mekong Cooperation Special Fund provides 2,430,000 RMB loan for poverty alleviation and forest preservation in Northeast Thailand
description: On December 24, 2019, the Chinese Government and Thailand Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) for poverty alleviation and forest preservation in Northeast Thailand. This project will be financed by a loan of 2,430,000 RMB from the Lancang-Mekong Cooperation Special Fund and implemented by the Royal Forest Department (see Umbrella Project ID #49339). The borrowing terms are unknown.   According to a report from the Chinese Embassy in Thailand, by March 2021, the forest poverty reduction demonstration zone project was launched in 8 communities in the Buengkan Province. Since the project's launch, 20,000 tree seedlings have been planted to develop Thailand's eco-tourism and forest economy.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Lancang-Mekong Cooperation Special Fund provides 2,430,000 RMB loan for poverty alleviation and forest preservation in Northeast Thailand

# Description
On December 24, 2019, the Chinese Government and Thailand Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) for poverty alleviation and forest preservation in Northeast Thailand. This project will be financed by a loan of 2,430,000 RMB from the Lancang-Mekong Cooperation Special Fund and implemented by the Royal Forest Department (see Umbrella Project ID #49339). The borrowing terms are unknown.   According to a report from the Chinese Embassy in Thailand, by March 2021, the forest poverty reduction demonstration zone project was launched in 8 communities in the Buengkan Province. Since the project's launch, 20,000 tree seedlings have been planted to develop Thailand's eco-tourism and forest economy.
justification: Project focuses on poverty alleviation and forest preservation, with no direct energy transition impact
evidence: Poverty alleviation and forest preservation focus, tree planting for eco-tourism and forest economy
